result.execSummary:
The defendant Alec Trevor Hatfield was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
11:10 AM Defendant Alec Trevor Hatfield appeared by video.  Attorney Richard S Gondik Jr appeared by video for Alec Trevor Hatfield.  Attorney Jennifer Gross in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances. Court reviews court record. Def Atty has sent in the plea questionairre. State recites the plea agreement and states that the Victim's Rights has been complied with and the victim does not want wish to make statement. Court verifies that all parties are able to see and hear the court proceedings via zoom. DEF and Def Atty agree that the Court may proceed with the plea/sentencing. Court discussion follows on DNA sample. DEF to contact Probation by the end of today (9/13/22) and follow their instructions, including scheduling for DNA sample. Court finds Victim Rights Legislation has been complied with. 22CM35 - Def pleads no contest to Count 1 & Count 2. Count 3 to be dismissed and read in. Def has received and went through the plea questionnaire with the Def Atty via phone/zoom & physically signed the document and returned. Court accepts his pleas and finds the DEF guilty. State comments on DEF criminal record. Def Atty replies to comment on criminal record. Court speaks to DEF. Court follows global resolution. Court authorizes a transfer of probation to another county or out of state if its approved. DEF must provide a DNA sample by 10/03/22 at the end of the business day. Court discusses with Def Atty and DEF on possible DNA sample through an alternative Sheriff's Department closer to the DEF location. Jail credit to be determined in which case it will be applied to if probation is revoked.

COURT: Withheld Sentence, 3 years probation, AODA and mental health assessment, and any other conditions of probation as required. 43 Day Credit (to be determined which case it will be applied to if probation is revoked - No credit for time in treatment)
Count 1: No Contest - $100 Fine plus court costs totaling $779. 
Count 2: No Contest - $100 Fine plus court costs totaling $679. 
Count 3: Dismissed and Read - In
Supervision Report - Justice Point
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 13, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Court calls case and recites appearances.  Attny Gondik indicates plea questionnaires have been electronically filed.  State begins to recites agreement, realizes victim rights have not been complied with.   Court resets plea/sentencing hearing.   Attny Gondik to schedule with JA, and DEF may appear by zoom.

1:08 PM Defendant Alec Trevor Hatfield in court.  Attorney Jacob Gondik appeared by video for Alec Trevor Hatfield.  Attorney Jennifer Gross in court for State of Wisconsin. BACK ON THE RECORD REGARDING BAIL BOND HEARING HELD EARLIER THIS DATE.  Court had modified bond for Defendant to go to treatment, which has been completed.  When DE was in treatment, amended to signature bond.  A cash bond had already been posted.  The requirement after May 10th DE was to report back to JusticePoint after treatment.  DE had been tested at the Sheriff's Department, and tested with a .042 alcohol level.  Court had earlier made an order that upon a clean test, the DE would be back with JusticePoint.  DE is not cooperating with JusticePoint.  Attny Gondik unable to come up with a recommendation at this time. State requests Court to revoke bond based on DE's non-compliance with Court orders. Court addresses parties. Attny. Gondik argues revoking bond as a whole.  Court addresses DE.  Court AMENDS bond in 22CM63 to $15,000.00 cash. DE to be taken into custody until the remaining $5000.00 is posted. 

Court AMENDS CASH BOND in 22CM63 to $15,000.00 -  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption of Alcoholic Beverages.  May not possess any controlled substance or paraphernalia.     No drug use without a valid prescription and if prescribed must take as DR ordered.  

Defendant shall be subject to testing of their blood, breath, saliva and/or urine to ensure compliance with absolute sobriety provision. Within 24 hours of release from custody (not including weekends/holidays) defendant shall report to Justice Point Pre-Trial Services at 10610 Main Street Suite 101, Hayward, WI 54843. Phone: 715-804-0109 OR 715-961-0149 for orientation and to establish testing procedures and options.
Request to appear by zoom Denied Per Judge. Contacted attroney Gondik's office to inform.

OFF THE RECORD / 11:25 AM Defendant Alec Trevor Hatfield appeared by video.  Attorney Richard S Gondik Jr appeared by video for Alec Trevor Hatfield.  Attorney Jennifer Gross in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Gondik indicates offer received, requests reset to allow time to discuss with DEF.  Court indicates a STC will be set and if PLEAS needed, parties to contact JA.  State indicates victim present who would like to speak.  

ON THE RECORD / 11:26AM - Court calls case, recites appearances, recounts off the record discussion.  Victim makes statement from gallery, request no contact lifted.  State indicates treatment completed but takes no position on lifting the no contact.  Atty Gondik makes statement, indicates he will leave decision to lift no contact up to the Court.  DEF provides his current location. Court would like record to reflect K.B. present, would like no contact lifted. DEF makes statement requesting no contact lifted.  Court indicates counsel is not taking a position, victim is requesting no contact, DEF has received treatment.  Court questions KB directly on lifting of no contact.  Court makes statement, modifying bond to no violent or abusive contact with KB.  Atty Gondik requests STC.  Court sets STC 9/6/22 at 11AM.  Court indicates DEF must sign modified bond before he may have contact with victim.  DEF understands.

COURT:  Modify bond  = No violent or abusive contact with K.B.  / Other conditions remain unchanged. 

Status conference scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 11:00 am.
